721156f-a.text:
56-58, 60-62 MacDougal Street, east side, north of Prince Street and opposite the eastern end of King Street, showing St. Anthony's School, the parochial school of the Roman Catholic Church of St. Anthony of Padua, on Sullivan Street. This building dates back to around 1890; prior to then the school occupied the old church edifice, next to the new one at 153 Sullivan Street (q.v.).
June 18, 1930.
P. L. Sperr.
721156f-a.folder: MacDougal Street & King Street, Manhattan, NY
